member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Exceptions.AddressNotFoundException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the IP address is not found in the database. This generally means that the address was a private or reserved address.

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Exceptions.GeoIP2Exception
member.summary: This class represents a generic GeoIP2 error. All other exceptions thrown by the GeoIP2 API subclass this exception

This record is returned by all the end points except the Country end point.

member.summary:
Contains data for the location record associated with an IP address.
This record is returned by all the end points except the Country end point.

member.name: M:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.AccuracyRadius
member.summary: The radius in kilometers around the specified location where the IP address is likely to be. This attribute is only available from the Omni end point.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude of the location as a floating point number. This attribute is returned by all end points except the Country end point.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude of the location as a floating point number. This attribute is returned by all end points except the Country end point.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.MetroCode
member.summary: The metro code of the location if the location is in the US. MaxMind returns the same metro codes as the Google AdWords API. This attribute is returned by all end points except the Country end point.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Location.TimeZone
member.summary: The time zone associated with location, as specified by the IANA Time Zone Database, e.g., "America/New_York". This attribute is returned by all end points except the Country end point

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.MaxMind
member.summary:
Contains data related to your MaxMind account.
This record is returned by all the end points.

member.name: M:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.MaxMind.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.MaxMind.QueriesRemaining
member.summary: The number of remaining queried in your account for the current end point.

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Postal
member.summary: Contains data for the postal record associated with an IP address. This record is returned by all the end points except the Country end point.

member.name: M:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Postal.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Postal.Code
member.summary: The postal code of the location. Postal codes are not available for all countries. In some countries, this will only contain part of the postal code. This attribute is returned by all end points except the Country end point.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Postal.Confidence
member.summary: A value from 0-100 indicating MaxMind's confidence that the postal code is correct. This attribute is only available from the Omni end point.

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.RepresentedCountry
member.summary:
Contains data for the represented country associated with an IP address.
This class contains the country-level data associated with an IP address for the IP's represented country. The represented country is the country represented by something like a military base or embassy.
This record is returned by all the end points.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.RepresentedCountry.Type
member.summary: A string indicating the type of entity that is representing the country. Currently we only return military but this could expand to include other types such as embassy in the future. Returned by all end points.

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Subdivision
member.summary:
Contains data for the subdivisions associated with an IP address.
This record is returned by all the end points except the Country end point.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Subdivision.Confidence
member.summary: This is a value from 0-100 indicating MaxMind's confidence that the subdivision is correct. This attribute is only available from the Omni end point.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Subdivision.IsoCode
member.summary: This is a string up to three characters long contain the subdivision portion of the code. This attribute is returned by all end points except Country.

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits
member.summary: Contains data for the traits record associated with an IP address. This record is returned by all the end points.

member.name: M:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.AutonomousSystemNumber
member.summary: The autonomous system number associated with the IP address. This attribute is only available from the City/ISP/Org and Omni end points.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.AutonomousSystemOrganization
member.summary: The organization associated with the registered autonomous system number for the IP address. This attribute is only available from the City/ISP/Org and Omni end points.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.Domain
member.summary: The second level domain associated with the IP address. This will be something like "example.com" or "example.co.uk", not "foo.example.com". This attribute is only available from the City/ISP/Org and Omni end points.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.IPAddress
member.summary: The IP address that the data in the model is for. If you performed a "me" lookup against the web service, this will be the externally routable IP address for the system the code is running on. If the system is behind a NAT, this may differ from the IP address locally assigned to it. This attribute is returned by all end points.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.IsAnonymousProxy
member.summary: This is true if the IP is an anonymous proxy. This attribute is returned by all end points. MaxMind's GeoIP FAQ

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.IsSatelliteProvider
member.summary: This is true if the IP belong to a satellite internet provider. This attribute is returned by all end points.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.Isp
member.summary: The name of the ISP associated with the IP address. This attribute is only available from the City/ISP/Org and Omni end points.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.Organization
member.summary: The name of the organization associated with the IP address. This attribute is only available from the City/ISP/Org and Omni end points.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Model.Traits.UserType
member.summary: The user type associated with the IP address. This can be one of the following values: business cafe cellular college content_delivery_network dialup government hosting library military residential router school search_engine_spider traveler This attribute is only available from the Omni end point.

member.summary: Represented country record for the requested IP address. The represented country is used for things like military bases or embassies. It is only present when the represented country differs from the country.

member.summary: Sets the locales on all the NamedEntity properties.

member.summary: Gets the city for the requested IP address.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.AbstractCityResponse.Location
member.summary: Gets the location for the requested IP address.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.AbstractCityResponse.Postal
member.summary: Gets the postal object for the requested IP address.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.AbstractCityResponse.Subdivisions
member.summary: An of objects representing the country subdivisions for the requested IP address. The number and type of subdivisions varies by country, but a subdivision is typically a state, province, county, etc. Subdivisions are ordered from most general (largest) to most specific (smallest). If the response did not contain any subdivisions, this method returns an empty array.

member.name: P:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.AbstractCityResponse.MostSpecificSubdivision
member.summary: An object representing the most specific subdivision returned. If the response did not contain any subdivisions, this method returns an empty object.

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.CityIspOrgResponse
member.summary:
This class provides a model for the data returned by the GeoIP2 City/ISP/Org end point.
The only difference between the City, City/ISP/Org, and Omni response classes is which fields in each record may be populated.
GeoIP2 Web Services

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.CityResponse
member.summary:
This class provides a model for the data returned by the GeoIP2 City end point.
The only difference between the City, City/ISP/Org, and Omni response classes is which fields in each record may be populated.
GeoIP2 Web Services

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.CountryResponse
member.summary:
This class provides a model for the data returned by the GeoIP2 Country end point.
The only difference between the City, City/ISP/Org, and Omni response classes is which fields in each record may be populated.
See GeoIP2 Web Services

member.name: T:MaxMind.GeoIP2.Responses.OmniResponse
member.summary:
This class provides a model for the data returned by the GeoIP2 Omni end point.
The only difference between the City, City/ISP/Org, and Omni response classes is which fields in each record may be populated.
GeoIP2 Web Services

summary.para: This class provides a client API for all the GeoIP2 web service's end points. The end points are Country, City, City/ISP/Org, and Omni. Each end point returns a different set of data about an IP address, with Country returning the least data and Omni the most.
Each web service end point is represented by a different model class which contains data about the IP address.
If the web service does not return a particular piece of data for an IP address, the associated property is not populated.
The web service may not return any information for an entire record, in which case all of the properties for that model class will be empty.

The basic API for this class is the same for all of the web service end points. First you create a web service object with your MaxMind userID and licenseKey, then you call the method corresponding to a specific end point, passing it the IP address you want to look up.
If the request fails, the client class throws an exception.
For details on the possible errors returned by the web service itself, see the GeoIP2 web service documentation.

member.name: M:MaxMind.GeoIP2.WebServiceClient.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
